DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the receiving the next therapy to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the receiving the next therapy to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Existing in time or space without stop or interruption.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Will the next cycle of system
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the next cycle of systemic therapy be given on treatment schedule

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient continue to receive protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient continue with protocol therapy as scheduled after this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient satisfy the conditions to continue treatment beyond progression occurring in the first 12 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient agree to continue treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: will the patient continue to receive treatment for a maximum of 4 weeks prior to a confirmation scan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: will the patient continue to receive treatment prior to a confirmation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will patient be continuing on therapy (Indeterminate response)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient continue to receive treatment for a minimum of 4 weeks prior to a confirmation scan?
